title: Understand Spontaneity Conditions
text: To determine the spontaneity of a reaction, we use the Gibbs free energy change, ΔG° . A reaction is spontaneous when ΔG° < $$0$$ .

title: Relation with Gibbs Free Energy
text:
The change in Gibbs free energy ΔG° at standard conditions is given by:

ΔG° $$=$$ ΔH° - T ΔS°

We need to find the temperature T such that ΔG° < $$0$$ .

title: Substitute Given Values into Gibbs Free Energy Equation
text: Substitute ΔH° $$=$$ $$-114$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and ΔS° $$=$$ $$-146$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$ into the Gibbs free energy equation, adjusting the units if necessary.

title: Determine Temperature for Spontaneity
text: For the reaction to be spontaneous, solve for T :\n\n$$0$$ > $$-114000$$ - $$T(-146)$$
choices: The reaction is not spontaneous at any temperature.
